result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Dobbins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED 2/23/17:  RESTITUTION ORDERED IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,294.94.

CORRECTED 3/1/17:  ONCE RELEASED FROM CUSTODY, DEFENDANT MUST MAKE PAYMENTS OF $50.00 PER MONTH TO BEGIN ON MAY 1, 2017.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must avoid contact with all drug users and drug dealers as identified by Probation Agent.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
